chapter.title: Backend
chapter.para: In the Backend, accessed via e.g. http://www.rsgallery2.nl/administrator/, you can manage your galleries, images and change the configuration settings for RSGallery2. You will find that RSGallery2 works very similar to the way you would make categories in Joomla (galleries in RSGallery2) or articles in Joomla (items, or images in RSGallery2). We will assume that you are logged in in your Backend of your Joomla site as a Super Administrator and as such have all the permissions a user can have.

First we will create a few galleries and upload some images (refered to as items here). Then a menu-item is created so our frontend users can see our galleries. Finally the Configuration settings are discussed as well as Permissions settings.

section.title: Galleries
section.para: Before you start creating galleries it's always a good idea to take a moment to think about the structure of galleries. Galleries can be nested, just like Joomla categories can be nested. See for an example.

section.title: Create a gallery
section.para: To create a gallery (users need to have Create permission) go to Manage Galleries: Backend > Components > RSGallery2 > Galleries (see ) and click New. You will see the screen shown in .
There are several settings in this screen

listitem.para: Name: sets the name of your gallery, it is the only required field.

Alias: you can leave this empty and Joomla will create an alias based on the Name you entered when you save the gallery or you can enter an alias yourself. The alias is used in Search Engine Friendly URLs, so the only characters allowed are lowercase letters and dashes, letters with a diacritic will automatically be converted (e.g. Ã¼ to either u (dutch) or ue (german), based on the transliteration of the language used).
Transliteration is handled by the language pack that you use. If you want to know how this works or how to override this, see for example http://docs.joomla.org/Making_a_Language_Pack_for_Joomla_1.6#Example_of_the_function_to_add_when_custom_transliteration_is_desired and http://docs.joomla.org/International_Enhancements_for_Version_1.6
Owner: shows which user owns the gallery. Users with Configure permission can change which user is the owner.
Access: sets wich usergroup can see this gallery in the frontend.
Permissions: this button will take you to the Gallery Permissions at the bottom of the page. It is only visible for users with Configure permission.
Description: the description for the gallery.
Parent gallery: sets the parent of this gallery. If galleries are nested you can see to which parent gallery a subgallery belongs to.
Gallery thumbnail (only available when the gallery holds items): by default a random thumbnail sized image is shown for the gallery, here you can choose a specific thumbnail.
Ordering: by default, a new gallery is saved to the first position. The order can be changed after the gallery is saved.
Published: is the gallery published or not?
Gallery Permissions: users wich Configure permission can set the allowed actions for each usergroup. See for more information on this subject.

section.para: Give your new gallery at least a Name and click Save (to save and return to this screen) or Save & Close (to save and return to the Manage Galleries screen ().

section.title: Example galleries
section.para:
As an example five galleries are created in this structure:
Cakes (only entered the Name here)
Flowers (only entered the Name here)
Hollidays (only entered the Name here)
France Embrun 2010 (entered the Name and chose Hollidays as Parent Gallery)
Switzerland 2009 (entered the Name and chose Hollidays as Parent Gallery)
shows the five galleries that were just created. You can tell that France Embrun 2010 and Switzerland 2009 are subgalleries of Hollidays, Hollidays is their parent gallery.

section.title: Change the order of galleries
section.para: Changing the order of the galleries is easiest in the Manage Galleries screen shown in , this works just like changing the order for Joomla Categories. A user needs Edit State permission to be allowed to change the order.
Go to the Manage Galleries screen via Backend > Components > RSGallery2 > Galleries. There are two ways to change the order:

listitem.para: In the Reorder column you can click the blue and white up and down icons to move each gallery individually (these icons are not shown for users without Edit State permission).
In the Order column you can change the numbers (but only when you have Edit State permission) and click the little Save Order floppy disk icon next to the Order text.

section.title: Change the state of the gallery: published or unpublished
section.para: The state of the gallery, published or unpublished, can be changed by users with Edit State permission. Changing the state of the galleries is easiest in the Manage Galleries screen shown in . All galleries shown in this image are published: there is a green icon with a white checkmark in the column Published. Unpublished galleries would have a red icon with a white dot inside. This works the same as in the rest of Joomla.
Go to the Manage Galleries screen via Backend > Components > RSGallery2 > Galleries. There are two ways to change the state:

listitem.para: Click the icon in the Published column to change the state from Published (green icon with with checkmark) to Unpublished (red icon with white dot) and vice versa.
Select one or more galleries by checking the checkboxes at the left of the gallery name and click the Publish or Unpublish icon in the toolbar at the top of the page.

section.title: Edit a gallery
section.para: You can edit the details for a saved gallery if you have Edit permission or Edit Own permission and you are the owner of the gallery. In the Manage Galleries screen (go there via Backend > Components > RSGallery2 > Galleries), either click on the gallery name, or check the checkbox left to the gallery name and click Edit. You can easily tell which galleries you are allowed to edit, because their names are links to the Edit Gallery screen.
The Edit Gallery screen is almost the same as the New Gallery screen (), so refer to for a descriptions of the settings.
We edit the gallery "Switzerland 200" that has a typo to change its name to "Switzerland 2009".

section.title: Delete a gallery
section.para: Deleting a galley is a two step proces, you will be asked to confirm the deletion in the second step. When a gallery is deleted, its items (images) and subgalleries will be deleted as well. Users need Delete permission to be able to delete a gallery.

A gallery can be deleted via the Manage Galleries screen (go there via Backend > Components > RSGallery2 > Galleries), check the checkbox left to the gallery or galleries you want to delete and click Delete. When you're sure you want to delete the selected galleries and their items (images) and subgalleries click Confirm Removal.

section.title: Items (images)
section.para:
Galleries contain items, for most users these items will be images with e.g. a title and description, we'll mix the usages of the words image and item.
RSGallery2 has also some capabilities for video and MP3 files, however, these capabilities are not discussed here and this function is currently 'as-is' and is not being developed.
The types of images that can be uploaded are jpg, jpeg, gif and png images.

section.title: Create items
section.para: An RSGallery2 item is created when you upload an image. Users need Create permission for a specific gallery to be able to upload images to that gallery. You can either upload up to ten single images via Upload or upload a batch of files via an archive (e.g. zip file) or via FTP. Both are explained in the next sections.

section.title: Upload
section.para: We'll start with uploading a few images via Upload: Backend > Components > RSGallery2 > Upload. See .
Here you can upload up to 10 single items. These are the settings

listitem.para: At the top you have to select a gallery, all uploaded images will go into this gallery. This list will show you all galleries available, but users can only select galleries for which they have Create permission. Note: "Top gallery" is not an actual gallery, you cannot place images there, only galleries.
You can give a description wich will be the description for each of the images that will be uploaded. This is not required.
Per image you can optionally give a title. If no title is given, the filename will be used, unless the image has ITPC settings for the title. @@Todo: link to IPTC configuration settings
The location of the file you want to upload is required: just click in the inputbox or on the Browse button and a window will open that lets you select your file.
At the bottom of the page you can press "(more files)" which will give you another set of inputboxes for a second image: title and file. This way you can upload up to ten images.

section.para: When ready, just click Upload in the toolbar at the top of the page. You are taken to the Manage Items screen when the image is uploaded successfully, it shows a list of your images. In this screen there is an Upload button in the toolbar that will take you to the Upload screen of figure that you just used to upload one or more images.

section.title: Batch Upload
section.para: Next we'll upload a batch of images via Batch Upload: Backend > Components > RSGallery2 > Batch upload. See . Batch upload is a two-step proces.
In the first step there are two choices:

listitem.para: Specify the upload method: Zip file (archive) or FTP.

Zip file (archive): browse to an archive file (e.g. zip file) and select it. Note: The size that such an archive file can have is not only determined by the upload limit set on your website, but also on time out limits. If an archive fails to upload either try a smaller archive file, or use the FTP method.

FTP: You will have to upload the images by FTP yourself to a location within your webroot. The location of the webroot is indicated on the screen. You can create, for example, a directory /tempupload/ in your webroot and put the full path to this directory here. For windows users who use Xampp (webaddress http://localhost/joomla25/) this may become C:\xampp\htdocs\rsgallery2\tempupload\ where the webroot is C:\xampp\htdocs\rsgallery2\. On *nix systems this may be /home/vhosts/rsgallery2.nl/httpdocs/tempupload/ where the webroot is /home/vhosts/rsgallery2.nl/httpdocs/ . Note: do not forget the trailing slash, without it you'll get a message "No files found to process!".

Specify the gallery: either choose the gallery that will hold all images that you will upload in this batch, or choose to specify the gallery for each of the images in the second step of the batch upload.

section.para: Click the toolbar button Next at the top to go to the second step.

In the second step you can (optionally) give each image a title and description, and indicate if an image in the archive should not be uploaded by marking the Delete checkbox. Depending on your choice in Specify gallery, you cannot change the gallery, or you will see a dropdown list of available galleries. See .
Click the toolbar button Upload to create the images in the chosen RSGallery2 gallery.
After the images are successfully uploaded you are redirected to either the Items screen (single file upload) or the Control Panel (Batch upload).

section.title: Change the order of items
section.para: Changing the order of the galleries is easiest in the Manage Items screen shown in , this works just like changing the order for Galleries. A user needs Edit State permission to be allowed to change the order.

Go to the Manage Items screen via: Backend > Components > RSGallery2 > Items. There are two ways to change the order:
In the Reorder column you can click the blue and white up and down icons to move each gallery individually (these icons are not shown for users without Edit State permission).
In the Order column you can change the numbers (but only when you have Edit State permission) and click the little Save Order floppy disk icon next to the Order text.

section.title: Change the state of the item: published or unpublished
section.para: The state of an item, published or unpublished, can be changed by users with Edit State permission. Changing the state of an item is easiest in the Manage Items screen shown in . All items shown in this image are published: there is a green icon with a white checkmark in the column Published. Unpublished galleries would have a red icon with a white dot inside. This works the same as in the rest of Joomla.
Go to the Manage Items screen via Backend > Components > RSGallery2 > Items. There are two ways to change the state:

listitem.para: Click the icon in the Published column to change the state from Published (green icon with with checkmark) to Unpublished (red icon with white dot) and vice versa.
Select one or more galleries by checking the checkboxes at the left of the item name and click the Publish or Unpublish icon in the toolbar at the top of the page.

section.title: Edit an item
section.para: You can edit the details for a saved item if you either have Edit permission or you have Edit Own permission and you are the owner of the item. In the Manage Item screen (go there via Backend > Components > RSGallery2 > Items), either click on the item name, or check the checkbox left to the item name and click Edit. You can easily tell which galleries you are allowed to edit, because their names are links to the Edit Gallery screen.
The Edit Gallery screen shows these settings:

Name: sets the name of your item, it is a required field.
Alias: you can leave this empty and Joomla will create an alias based on the Name you entered when you save the item or you can enter an alias yourself. The alias is used in Search Engine Friendly URLs, so the only characters allowed are lowercase letters and dashes, letters with a diacritic will automatically be converted (e.g. Ã¼ to either u (dutch) or ue (german), based on the transliteration of the language used).
Transliteration is handled by the language pack that you use. If you want to know how this works or how to override this, see for example http://docs.joomla.org/Making_a_Language_Pack_for_Joomla_1.6#Example_of_the_function_to_add_when_custom_transliteration_is_desired and http://docs.joomla.org/International_Enhancements_for_Version_1.6
Owner: shows which user owns the item. Users with Configure permission can change which user is the owner.
Filename: shows the filename (this cannot be changed).
Gallery: shows which gallery the item belongs to, it is a required field.
Permissions: this button will take you to the Item Permissions at the bottom of the page. It is only visible for users with Configure permission.
Description: the description for the item.
Ordering: change the order of the items in the gallery. Note: if you change the gallery an item belongs to, first save your changes and then you can change the order of the items in that gallery. E.g. this list only shows the items in the gallery that the item belonged to when you started to Edit this item.
Published: is the item published or not?
Item Permissions: users wich Configure permission can set the allowed actions for each usergroup. See for more information on this subject.
Besided these Settings in the Details section, there is also an Item preview, showing the Display image for this item. Two parameters called Link and Link text that are used for one of the RSGallery2 plugins (see ) and the links to the Thumbnail, Display and Original images for this item for quick display and reference for the user.

Make the changes you want and click either Save (to return to this screen) or Save & Close (to return to the Manage Items screen). If you do not want to apply your changes you can click Cancel and you're taken to the Manage Items screen.

section.title: Delete an item
section.para: In the Manage Item screen (, go there via Backend > Components > RSGallery2 > Items), you can delete images for which you have delete permission. Check the checkboxes corresponding to the images you want to delete and click Delete. Be carefull though, you won't be asked to confirm your deletion!

section.title: Copy of move an item
section.para: Items can be moved or copied to a different gallery than they currently belong to in the Manage Item screen (, go there via Backend > Components > RSGallery2 > Items). Check the checkboxes corresponding to the images you want to either move or copy and in the Copy/Move box select the destination gallery. Then click either Move To or Copy depending on what you want.

section.title: Reset hits
section.para: In the Manage Item screen (, go there via Backend > Components > RSGallery2 > Items) there is a column with the number of Hits for each item. This counts the number of times the specific image is shown individually (see ).
You can reset this number to 0 by selecting the images for which you want to reset the number of hits and then clicking Reset hits.

section.title: Create an RSGallery2 menu item
section.para: Frontend users can only see your galleries and images if you provide them with a menu link to your galleries. Such a menu link is created in the Backend.
We're assuming that you are logged in in the Backend and that you have Joomlas Sampla Data installed. We will create a menu link in the About Joomla menu.

Go to the Menu Manager: Backend > Menus > Menu Manager, this will show you all your available menus. Click on About Joomla. There is also a shorter way to get here: Backend > Menus > About Joomla, you can use either way. This will take you to the Menu Manager for the About Joomla menu, see , in this screen you click on New. You are taken to a screen where you can enter all the details of your new menu item ( shows the screen with the details filled out). Menu Manager: About Joomla menu

figure.title: Menu Manager: New Menu Item with RSGallery2 View of galleries chosen

section.para: First, click on select next to Menu Item Type, a new window will popup (). Find RSGallery2 and you'll see two options, choose View of galleries. Menu Manager: New Menu Item: Select a Menu Item Type

With your choice two of the fields in the New Menu Item screen are filled: the Menu Item Type and the Link. You need to give your new menu item a title at Menu Title. Enter for example 'Photos'. At the right of the screen you'll see some component specific settings. For this menu item you can choose which gallery to use as a base gallery. By default Root gallery is chosen, this is the top level that contains all galleries. This Root gallery has no images of its own. We'll choose Root gallery here.
shows the settings that we've chosen. Now click on Save and your menu item is created. Check this in the frontend ().

Frontend: About Joomla menu has a new link: Photos
Of course you can create another menu item, also with the type View of galleries, but with a different gallery. Try that and see in the frontend what you'll get with this setting. And instead of the type View of galleries you can also make a menu item with the type Slideshow view instead of View of galleries. This will give your frontend user a menu item showing a slideshow for a specific gallery. Here you cannot choose the Root gallery (remember, the Root gallery only contains galleries, no images), you can choose any gallery from the list.

section.title: Configurations settings
section.para: RSGallery2 has many settings to allow you to display your images the way you would like to. They are all set in the Configuration. Go to the Backend > Components > RSGallery2 > Control Panel and click on Configuration. The Configuration shows a set of four tabs: General, Images, Display and My galleries (see ). Configuration
The settings on each of these tabs will be explained in the next sections.
When you want to change settings you have to click the Save button after you choose a new setting, only then will a new setting be applied.
